title: The key areas where South Africa have excelled on their way to the Rugby World Cup final
text:
The Springboks have booked their ticket to a third Rugby World Cup final after defeating Wales in Yokohama on Sunday.

Here are the key areas where South Africa have excelled in Japan.

Consistency of selection

One similarity shared by England and South Africa is that, so far at least, their selections have not been overly affected by injury.

Jesse Kriel was ruled out following the opening defeat to New Zealand, and Cheslin Kolbe missed the semi-final against Wales, yet by and large Erasmus has been able to consistently select the side he wants.

During South Africa’s toughest three matches since that opening defeat to New Zealand, against Italy in the pool stages and then in the knockouts against...
description: The Springboks have booked their ticket to a third Rugby World Cup final after defeating Wales in Yokohama on Sunday.
